description: Leading development of core platform features and mentoring junior developers.
situation: Joined a growing startup where the platform needed to scale to handle increasing user demand.
approach: Implemented microservices architecture and established code review practices to improve code quality.
technical_work: Built RESTful APIs using Node.js, implemented caching layer with Redis, migrated legacy monolith to microservices.
lessons_learned: Communication is key when working with distributed teams. Technical debt should be addressed incrementally.

description: Developed and maintained web applications for enterprise clients.
situation: Worked on a team responsible for building customer-facing applications with high availability requirements.
approach: Focused on writing clean, testable code and implementing CI/CD pipelines for faster deployments.
technical_work: Built React frontend applications, implemented automated testing with Jest and Cypress, set up GitHub Actions workflows.
lessons_learned: Automated testing saves time in the long run. Good documentation helps onboard new team members faster.
highlights: Reduced deployment time from hours to minutes

description: Started career as a junior developer working on various web projects.
situation: Entry-level position at a small startup where I had the opportunity to learn multiple technologies.
approach: Took initiative to learn new technologies and volunteered for challenging projects.
technical_work: Built web applications using JavaScript and PHP, worked with MySQL databases, learned basic DevOps practices.
lessons_learned: Startups offer great learning opportunities. Being proactive accelerates career growth.
highlights: Promoted to mid-level developer in 18 months
Built internal tools that saved 10 hours/week
